subject: Re: [junit] Test Fixture Setup
msgSnippet: ... Or use JUnit 4: public class MyClass { @BeforeClass public static void fixtureSetup() { // performed once for the whole class } @BeforeClass public static
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

>Mark Levison wrote:
>
>
>>In NUnit/.NET land we had test FixtureSetup/FixtureTearDown (run once for
>>each test fixture, not once a test case) in addition to regular setUp and
>>tearDown. I've tended to use these methods when I want to do something
>>expensive (File I/O etc.). While I know I should avoid expensive operations
>>in my test cases sometimes they are very useful. So is there are a standard
>>idiom for doing fixture setup? Do I resort to statics?
>>
>>
>
>Yes. Use TestSetup to set them up:
>
> public static Test suite() {
> return new TestSetup(new TestSuite(MyClass.class)) {
> // override setUp()
> // override tearDown()
> };
> }
>
>
Or use JUnit 4:

public class MyClass {
@BeforeClass public static void fixtureSetup() {
// performed once for the whole class
}

@BeforeClass public static void moreFixtureSetup() {
// performed once for the whole class
}

@AfterClass public static void fixtureTeardown() {
// performed once for the whole class
}
}

Cheers,

David Saff
